utterances.sentences: You're on Regret Island, not Fantasy Island, buddy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Nicely done.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Indeed. It depends on who I'm with. Let's say that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Ohhh! Juan, first thing you do?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, I think the question might be headed in a different direction. But I'll tell you, literally the first thing I do is I wash off all this makeup.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's true. My wife goes nuts. Because if I forget that and it's all over the pillow cases.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes, it's everywhere.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's like the Shroud of Turin.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I just take off all my clothes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No!

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: No, I mean no. I just take off my shoes, Gutfeld. All right. I take off my shoes. And then I DVR "The Five," and I watch it.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: You watch yourself naked?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: You get dressed before you watch yourself?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He watches himself...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Naked. That's what he does!

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes, you do. You just said it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Gutfeld, get your mind out of the gutter.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: You find yourself disgusting?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, jeez.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Downhill.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I say hello to Peter and Jasper and then I do take my makeup off.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's good.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Put my hair in a pony tail.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Do you really?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: God, I so don't do that. I mean, I just don't.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: The first thing I do is...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I stay like this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I unhook Steven from the basement chain.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's nice of you. It's a long day.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Steven?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: What happened to Dobbs?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Dobbs doesn't talk to me anymore. Joanne D. This is a great question. An excellent question. Think about this one. Joanne D. asks, "Would you rather travel back in time to meet your ancestors or to the future to meet your descendants and why?"

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, that's easy for me.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Why? What?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, I don't have any descendants, so I'm going to have to go back in time. But I would love, love, love, love, love to go back in time and see my family.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes? What if they're jerks?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's OK.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes? They probably are. You know, people in way back then, they were definitely jerky.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I would like to go and talk to them about their decision to -- to immigrate to America.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right. Good question. Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Well, the Watters family comes from a very long line of prestigious and noble men.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Naked people.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: From Norway.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Supercilious Norwegians.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes. I'd go back, obviously.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You'd go back, too.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I'd go back. I'd go back.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I think just going back, Juan, I'd be disappointed. Everybody'd be disappointed, because you know, they don't -- they're not up on the latest trends, hygiene-wise. The 1700s was a smelly period.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes, kind of like what President Trump might call a...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He turned middle ages.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: All those people who are coming over here. Not acceptable.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Here we go.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I would go forward.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Because you know what? I love history. So I always am curious. And, you know, being a black American, I -- there's huge holes going back, so I would fill in a lot of holes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: S-holes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes, not that one.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Eww!

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, I mean, it was a play -- play on words.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You walked right into that one, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: But going forward, I think it would be -- I mean, one of the questions I have in my mind as I get older is, you know, will I see my grandchildren, like, graduate and get married, stuff like that? I'd love...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes, you will.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: He wants to see all the pictures so he can post them.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, no. You know, I'm going to send them to Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: "One More Thing." Kimberly, would you rather go in the Flintstones' direction or the Jetsons' direction? Backwards or forwards?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I would probably want to go backwards, believe it or not. I think so. I would be a little bit torn about it, you know, because it was good to go back, depending on how far you could go back. But then I would also probably like to, you know, see the descendants of my son.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: This question is irrelevant to me, because I will be living forever. My brain in a vat of nutrients. That's how it's going to be. I'll be there.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Perfect world: no body, just my brain in a vat.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Perfect.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Smiling.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: No mouth?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No mouth.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Excellent.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No smiling. I'll be thinking about smiling. You know what makes me smile? "One More Thing."

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Ah, perfect.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Transition.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Transition.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: What is wrong with you?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Nothing.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: It's time now for "One More Thing." Kimberly, you go first. Thanks.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Sure.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: All right. This is a very cute story. Dana, you're going to love it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I'm paying attention.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: It's very nice. Happy ending for a sweet dog. And this is a dog that's a Pyrenees in Seminole, Oklahoma. Kathleen is a six-year-old. Look at her, so cute -- Great Pyrenees mix. When her owners moved and could not keep her, they gave her to someone who lived 20 miles away. She missed her old family, so not once but twice she walked 20 miles back home in search of them, to try to find them, to be reunited.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Aww.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: The Seminole Humane Society took control and worked to find her a new home. We have very good news. There was tons of applications all across the country. And today, she has been adopted and will be moving to Texas to be with her new forever family.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Isn't is that so sweet?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Aww.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: She ate a little cheeseburger.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Cute.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Ate a little cheeseburger. Can you imagine? I kind of feel sad she can't be with that family. But nevertheless, thank you, Texas family. Great state of Texas.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Peter had a dog in his life that did that once. So cute.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right. Enough about dogs, OK? Saturday, "Greg Gutfeld Show," 10 p.m. I've got Pete Hegseth. You know him. Comedian Alli Breen. She's hilarious. Kat Timpf, you know her. And of course, Tyrus. Now it's time for something very important.

utterances.speaker: GRAPHIC
utterances.sentences: Greg's Doppelganger News

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: "Greg's Doppelganger News." That's a foreign word for double. Anyway. Take a look at Fluffy McPawpaw over here, has happily met her double.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And they got along quite well, until she realized that her double is dead and stuffed.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Aww.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's a terrible prank to play on Fluffy McPawpaw. Now she'll be in therapy for the remaining nine lives.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: OK. So no dog stories, but like, weird cat stories with a fake cat?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Exactly. You figured me out.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes, I'm onto you. Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, talking about hating on TV. Look at this. One woman's trip to the bowling alley...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Say what?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: ... with her family in Brazil was a smash hit on local TV. And I mean really a hit. Watch as this woman practices her bowling technique.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Oh, my God!

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Did she have to pay for that?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Instead of gliding down the lanes, the ball goes up so high it crashes into a television monitor hanging from the ceiling. I don't know if she had to pay for the TV, but obviously, this was a strike on the media. Terrible.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Let me give her some lessons.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Who's got to pay for that?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I don't know.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Come on.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: They've got to have insurance.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: It's crazy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It is.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Well, I stole this from idea Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, good.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And I admit it. But when I heard that his alma mater, Berkeley, was bringing in therapy llamas for the snowflakes who were stressed out about exams, I decided to bring my own therapy llama to the set of "Watters' World." Here's a taste.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: What's it got? It's got something.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: It's got a piece of hay in its mouth.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It's got...

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Take it out. Go ahead.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You want me to take the...

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: See if you can take it out. I think you can do it. I think you can do it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Oh, oh! I touched its lip.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK. So the therapy llama and I had a nice time together. And you're going to see the whole thing, 8 p.m. Eastern Saturday night.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: You're really upping the ante on the Saturday night show. What are you going to do next week?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I'm going to have two llamas.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: By the way, here's what I heard around the building.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: What's that?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: The llama stinks.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's true.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: OK, I will go. So the Tour Down Under cycling race has begun in Australia. As one reporter prepared for her hit, watch this, a different story unfolded. So she's there just talking about it, talking about it. And this truck comes by and takes the whole thing down.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Wow.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Right there on live TV and didn't even stop. And these people spent all this time to put it up. But they got it up in time again for the first cyclists to pass through. And the race is just getting started and continues through through next week. It's hot down there, too.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: That's strange.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Not very good.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Not as strange as the weird llama thing. I don't even know.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Hard to care about bicyclists.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I have a lot of stress in my life.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: All right. By the way, you stressed out the llama. It needs a therapy llama.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: True.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Set your -- yes. Set your DVRs. Never miss an episode of "The Five." Everybody have a great weekend. "Special Report" is next. utterances.speaker: DON LEMON, CNN HOST
utterances.utterance: The president of the United States is racist.

utterances.speaker: REP. LUIS GUTIERREZ, D-ILLINOIS
utterances.utterance: We now know that we have in the White House someone who could lead the Ku Klux Klan in the United States of America, somebody who could be the leader of the neo-Nazis and publish just his words.

utterances.speaker: AL SHARPTON, AMERICAN CIVIL RIGHTS ACTIVIST
utterances.utterance: This is someone who has chosen a path that is absolutely racism with steroids.

utterances.speaker: ANDERSON COOPER, JOURNALIST AND HOST, CNN
utterances.utterance: Perhaps the White House feels the president's remarks will well received in some parts of the country, among some parts, the president's base. And perhaps that is true. But it doesn't make what he said any less ignorant or any less racist.

utterances.speaker: JASON JOHNSON, MSNBC CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.utterance: Our president is a clear and present danger to non-white people in America. It's that simple.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: All right, so, obviously, some widespread criticism. And of course, people on the left, Jesse, that have disfavor with the president find that he is racist and bring his base and to say that the base is also racist and that he shouldn't be in the White House, not fit to govern. JESSE WATTERS, "THE FIVE" CO-HOST: Yes, I mean, the leftist seized on this, but Trump gave them the weapon. He should not have said it. It wasn't a classy thing to say. It was crude. It was rude. I wouldn't say it but Trump is offensive. We've known Trump is offensive for a very long time. So, it shouldn't come as any surprise.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: He also issued a denial of it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, no one knows exactly what was said except him and the people in the room. But putting that aside, the point he was making is that these countries that he was talking about -- I don't believe S hole countries, they are impoverished, they are riddled with corruption, and they have a lot of problems. What that said, he was saying he believes in merit based immigration. That was, I think, what he was trying to get at, because people in the room are saying, let's do a deal, let's bring in these people from third world countries, and the president has made it very clear, he wants to bring in people that are based on merit, whether it's a high education, whether it's English speaking. Those are the things that he wants to focus on. Immigration policy, he is trying to put forth, that's the priority for him. What got lost in his gaffe, I would say, was that people now are talking about that. And the deal is really hanging in the balance. He had a lot of momentum going into this. The tax thing was doing great. He had a great meeting and he was going to bring together a lot of people on the immigration overhaul. Now, all that's been lost, so he needs to do a lot to regain the momentum. I dislike the people on the left who -- and I know people and you know people who have been at cocktail people, they call the Bronx (ph) an S-hole. They call middle America and S-hole. These people that are in their studio, they're putting people down, they live in different parts of the country, they call the Celtics (ph), they call Christians bad things, people that say bad things, you know. What did Obama say about bitter clingers (ph)? Hillary called half of the country deplorable people. So the reaction in the media when they say Trump says this about another country, there have been Democrats that said horrible things about people in our own country and have not gotten criticized nearly as much as the president. So there's a little hypocrisy there, but again with that said, obviously, the president said the wrong thing here and has to do a lot better moving forward when it comes to blunt talk.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: OK, all right, so, Dana, how do you see this in terms of, you know, the communications being handled by the White House in response to this? DANA PERINO, "THE FIVE" CO-HOST: Well, you know, if they wanted to deny it, last night would have been the night to deny it. Apparently , there were reports that there were calls being made as to check in with people that they would like to talk to and everybody was given the thumb's up. And then this morning, that changed and he said that's not actually what I said. So we are actually two things now. We are having people who are defending the comments, but even if he didn't say the comments, the comments are OK. I mean, some of the defenders are saying that. So, agreeing with what Jesse said, it's not exactly surprising that you would have profanity in the White House. This happened in every White House. Remember in 2000 when I think President Bush, at the time a candidate said at one of The New York Times reporters, was a major league A-hole. GREG GUTFELD, "THE FIVE" CO-HOST: Really? Damn.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And (INAUDIBLE) said big time. OK, then you have Joe Biden in the White House saying -- when he was about to sign Obamacare, you know, Mr. President, this is a big F-ing deal. Profanity is not the issue. The sentiment is. But I would say that aside from all of that, I don't need to go into how I feel about it, he question is, what do you want to accomplish and what do you need to do and who do you need to help you do it? And Senator Dick Durbin is one of those people. And what happened is, this makes it so much harder for Dick Durbin to convince Democrats to go along with him, to try to get this deal done. And this is not just about the DACA deal.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It's about the spending and the chip money for children's health insurance program because now there are Democrats on that side that are going to dig in and they're going to say, I am not going to want to be a part that, you have to push back harder on President Trump. The sad thing is on Tuesday they had a really good meeting. And by Friday now I think they're farther apart and they were earlier in the week. And they got seven days until the next government shutdown.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: OK. So, Greg, it wasn't (INAUDIBLE) timing to say at least (INAUDIBLE) Dana points out Durbin and others and a bit of a physician that president is denying that he said this. But the timing of it perhaps should have come quickly on the Hill yesterday. Where does it go from here? What do you make of it?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, Durbin is a bozo. Let's be frank on this one. I mean, this is a guy who said chain migration is a racist term because of the word chain. So let's not forget that. The big issue, the thing that really bugs me, it's not fair that all the other networks get to say the word and we can't.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's your take?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know when you were a kid and one of your friends' parents lets him go see R-rated movies, but your parents won't. That's Fox News. They won't let us say the word. Actually, they haven't told this, but --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Fox News is the parent?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: If the Fox News is saying -- you know what I mean? I asked if we could say the word and they said we could not.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: They shut you down?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, they shut me down.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: (INAUDIBLE) here.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There is also a sense here. I don't appreciate the language either. In fact, actually, when you hear it, you go, you know, I hope he means the countries and not the people.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Don't you think that -- I mean, he's not afraid --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I am hoping. I am hoping, but that has to be asked, if he means the people. He needs to clarify, did he mean the countries? I am hoping he meant the country. He could prove that by just saying merit based immigration can take people from those S-hole countries. You have to separate these two issues. I can believe that these countries are really bad, but people that come there can be really good. That's all he has to do. I think -- like I say, I find the word terrible and all of that stuff. But I am not going to be self-righteous about it. Because when I watch the media do it, I just want to -- I just can't handle how self-righteous the sanctimonious they are. I mean, these are people that if they went to a gym and there wasn't the right smoothie bar in there, they would call that an S hole, especially if they were living in New York City. If a gym did not have a personalized TV in front of their stair climber, that's an S-hole. I mean, everybody uses that word. You are right about the sentiment. That is why I think that you have to divide it. But the point is, and then I will shut up, it's always going to be about rhetoric versus action. Right now, nothing Donald Trump has done in terms of action has been the problem. In fact, the country is doing really well. We have high optimism in small business. We got crazy stock market. People are getting bonuses. There might be a secular revolution. You are seeing North Korea things happening. But the issue among the media is always going to be this coarse rhetoric which we all, I think, admit has always been the problem. Donald Trump makes Donald Trump a heavy lift for everybody. Because it's like a four- hour drive to Disneyland right when it's closing. You only get an hour ride. And that's what Trump is. He's a four-hour ride to Disneyland when it's about to close. As long as the economy does well and his actions are good, people will accept this heavy lift. But the economy goes down and there is an ugly -- something bad happens, then it's going to be an issue. I think people already know what they got.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Right. People are getting caught up on semantics. You know, disapprove of the language. This is nothing new that we've seen in White House administration or Congress, whatever, every place, workplace. However, Greg, he brought up one good point finally, thank God.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: The list of accomplishments. We are super focused here on the language, but what about the accomplishments? Shouldn't the Democrats be fair and focus on that as well? JUAN WILLIAMS, "THE FIVE" CO-HOST: I think anybody can be fair, but this is not about being fair. The man told a lie this morning that compounded his racial comments yesterday. His own White House did not deny it. And now he comes out. I guess he is watching "Fox & Friends." But even people who are "Star Wars" supporters are saying hey, this is really unforgivable. He shouldn't have done this. It's wrong. And then he said, I didn't quite say it that way. You know, the language was not quite the same. I am amazed how many Republicans are put into the difficult position of having to defend President Trump over and over again. And distracting from the agenda, maybe it's intentional distraction, I don't know. But in this case, he has offended people so deeply, yet Republicans are like, like Paul Ryan, you know, it was wrong, that should have not done. But he won't say, you know what, this is across the line. You can't say this about fellow people in this world, certainly Americans. How many Haitian Americans, African-Americans are making a great contribution to this country? People who are hardworking. To Greg's point, this is not about the countries, Greg. It is about the people.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He hasn't clarified that. He hasn't clarified that.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Allow me to speak. The reason that I say it is about the people is because it was in the course of a discussion about the lottery. You know, he wants the lottery done away with. Why do we need a lottery to get in here? He wants to cut legal immigration in half. The lottery system, he objects to on the basis that it should be about merit, it shouldn't be about a lottery.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: The lottery was created, however, because there is a shortage of people coming from certain countries in the normal flow. So the idea was we are going to try to engineer it as to repair that and create opportunities for people from all over the world as American immigrants. He then comes back and says, oh no, we don't want people from those countries. That's about people, Greg. And to say that -- imagine what you would say to the Irish, the Irish coming from famine, the Jews coming from Germany, the Italians. I got what you're saying now. And you're saying about people of color.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I get it. I get it.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: They want to come here because their countries aren't doing well.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Comparing them to Norwegians.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: If he said meritocracy based immigration allows people from those countries in, it's fine. But if he says it doesn't, then you're right. But we don't know that.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: It would be contrary to what we see on the statue of liberty. It doesn't say we will take your brightest and richest. It says we will take people --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So you are against the whole meritocracy thing?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, no, no. Let's have a discussion. What I am saying is, what he said yesterday was so deeply offensive and wrong. I can't believe that Republicans and even Trump people should be up in arms. He somehow suggested oh, his people would agree to this? They are not all racist.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I think they understand that he is your rude, rich uncle.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: He is using colorful language and nevertheless when you look at the merits of what he is talking about, should be a merit based system. There are serious significant problems with chain migration. So, language aside, those have to be dealt with in a responsible way. The private and security debate front and center again on Capitol Hill as the senate now takes on the new FISA bill, next.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: A bill to extend the NSA authority to conduct foreign surveillance on U.S. soil passed easily in the House yesterday. Now, the Senate is considering the measure. FISA supporters see the act as a vital tool to stop terrorism.

utterances.speaker: JACK KEANE, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.utterance: If we had it before 9-11, likely we would have detected what they were doing. We would have the full authority to monitor, to track their phone calls and also to surveil their phone calls. In other words, listen to them. We had it since. It makes all the sense in the world. It is critical if we are going to give our intelligence agency, particularly the National Security Agency, the ability to monitor terrorists' phone calls.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Privacy advocates like Rand Paul are concerned about Americans getting caught up in warrantless spying.

utterances.speaker: SEN. RAND PAUL, R-KENTUCKY
utterances.utterance: What we have is a program called the foreign intelligence surveillance act and you're supposed to be or the granted power is to spy on foreigners in foreign lands. I am all for that. We need to protect our country. Millions of Americans are recorded in there. So if the president calls a European leader or the Russian leader, the Chinese leader, the president's phone call is recorded, believe it or not. There are a lot of innocent people who are in here and it should not be searched for American data without a warrant. All we are asking is, go to a judge and have some evidence to get started. Warrants are not that difficult to get.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: The senator threatened to filibuster, but he can't. Mitch McConnell set up a parliamentary path to block him next week. So, it looks like it is going to pass. Greg, is that good or bad?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, it's good. I think it's good. But, you know, I love spying. You can't connect the dots without the dots. And if you don't think we need dots, then your dot is you probably hate people with freckles. That is, the least secure countries in the world are also the least free. And I know this is why I lose all my libertarian credentials. I don't care. I'll take the heat. I love heat. Freedom and security, they are not these things in conflict. They are actually like spouses that enhance each other. And you can't be the freest country, the most beloved country in the world, the country everybody wants to go to without being the most secure. You have to have that. And there is a way to do that and still be even more free. The problem is we get stuck in this weird argument. It's an argument that existed before technology and terror, which is that security somehow, it impinges on freedom. It doesn't, it enhances it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: (INAUDIBLE), Jesse, it is a six-year re-authorization, so we may not ever have to talk about it again in this room. We might still be on air.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Thank, God.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Some of us.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Betting on yourself again?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Few things wrong, but one of the things they got right were these tools they put in place to track down terrorists. Enhance interrogation, block sites were incredible tools that they put in place after 9-11. But I think the FISA and the warrantless surveillance was the best thing they did. It stopped over 50 to 60 plots. Some plots were targeting the New York City subway, the New York stock exchange. They identify the bomber from this. They can track down cyber threats. So I think this is fine. Right now, I think we are surveilling 100,000 foreigners overseas. Sometimes those foreigners call here. And they may or may not talk to an American. That automatically gets picked up. It doesn't get read, but it get stored. And sometimes you need to look into the American phone call or e-mail quickly. The argument against Rand Paul is that you don't have time. If there is a ticking time bomb situation, Kimberly knows, if you are really trying to go after these people hardcore, you don't have time to go to a judge and get a warrant. That's the argument. You can always go backwards. If you lean forward on the war on terror, this is crucial. He is not going to be able to do the filibuster so it doesn't even matter.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes. Kimberly, there has been successful challenge to this, I don't think, from a privacy perspective in the court, is that right?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes. Because when you think about what is weighed in the balance in terms of national security or dealing with terrorism or dealing with circumstances where time is of the essence, quick response, you have to be able to get that and narrow that down. We saw things like this in terms of, remember San Bernardino and the terrorists there, and try to be able to track them and track them through the cellphones immediately through direct messaging or other, you know, encryption. It's really a battle against these really and well defined and pretty sophisticated means of communication that we have now today with telegraph and signals and encryption and then also trying to balance that, trying to work cooperatively with some of these phone providers, things of that nature, like we saw Apple push back and try to protect their users and not let you have the information. But I understand from prosecutor's perspective of wanting to get that. I don't think anybody is trying to go and trying to abuse it. As weird as Greg is, we really want to hear what he is doing with his phone? No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You would be lucky if you knew, Kimberly.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: People who support this intelligence and law enforcement say there are protections for Americans embedded in this. It seems like it's never enough for the ones who have privacy concerns.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, the number one person is Donald Trump. Yesterday, he did a total flip flop, right, initially tweeting that he was opposed to the extension of this law, and apparently looking at his own circumstance and saying, oh, maybe some of the Trump campaign people got caught up when America was, guess what, tapping phones in Russia and hurt some of his campaigners. He said, oh, no, this is a terrible thing. And then he gets into whether it's unmasking that is involved because, as Jesse just explained to you, sometimes, American agent have this looked and see what was said especially if they identified potential threat. And then Donald Trump apparently was then pressured by Paul Ryan and others who said, hey, wait a second, don't forget we are trying to protect the country. It is not about something bigger than you, it is about the terrorist threat. And you see people from across the political spectrum saying this is important. But when you come back to it, it is what Donald Trump's initial objection was. I think Judge Napolitano said on our own network said it opens the door to people getting caught up. American citizens in this wider net. So you get people like Rand Paul, Mike Lee and others saying, hey, wait a second, let's put in some of these protections. But right now I think people are so worried the protections could limit the capacity of our agents that they are not willing to do it. To me, the story here is Donald Trump.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But it is going to pass. He said he is going to sign it. So we might actually have bipartisanship.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Boo.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: All right, one celebrity takes on another for an insensitive tweet following the California mudslides, next.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: We have seen the heartbreaking pictures of the California mud slide. It's devastating out west. At least 17 dead, people missing, hundreds of homes destroyed, many roads still closed. Apparently one actress didn't watch the news, because she didn't know what was affecting her commute. Bell Thorne tweeted, quote, F you 101 to Santa Barbara. I'm missing my boyfriend's first date on his tour, end quote. Well, that tweet didn't sit well with fellow actor Rob Lowe. He fired back on social media, quote, this attitude is why people hate celebrities, Hollywood. Bella, I'm sorry you were inconvenienced. We will try to move out our dead quicker, end quote. Gee, that prompted Thorne to delete her original tweet. She then posted another one. Quote, expletive, just caught up on some news. Had no idea why the 101 was shut down. Get home to your family safe. The man who hates Hollywood on this show, Greg Gutfeld.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I get with Rob Lowe, why he was upset, but we've all been guilty of this and it's like, you know, she is a young person. Young people make mistakes. I imagine if Instagram or Twitter were around when Rob Lowe was young, he might have had a few problems, if you know what I mean. Look --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I'm sure it was Snapchat --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Snapchat instead. My point is this. You know, she made a mistake. I -- human beings have a hard time thinking globally when something is happening to them. For example, there are studies on this. If you have a hangnail, you will think about that hangnail. You won't think about a boat capsizing, you know, off the coast of Libya. That you'll be thinking about that. I went through the same -- I was on a train ride with my wife. We were going to -- from the U.K. -- London to Birmingham in the U.K. And the train got stuck for 3 hours because somebody had jumped in front of it. And you know, everybody -- the only thing that people are thinking about -- they're not thinking about that guy or the family of the guy. They're thinking about, are we going to miss this important doctor's appointment? Are we going to be able to get there for the audition? That's how humans think. It's a flaw. It's part of natural selection to think about ourselves, and that's why -- I can't believe I'm actually defending a shallow and superficial idea.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: And using Darwin to do it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, I did. Thank you very much.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: So I'll take the other point of view, which is Rob Lowe identified her as a very self-involved actress.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: All concerned about her boyfriend but showing a tremendous lack of understanding about -- or empathy for people who were suffering as a result of these mudslides.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: You're saying that Rob Lowe showed a lack of empathy?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Or she did.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, that's what he said.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I guess she's saying she had no idea what was going on. So, you know, it's obvious. I'll take her at her word. Perhaps this was an innocent mistake. She tried to -- perhaps we could have been more artful or eloquent in making kind of an apology or saying she didn't realize it. But he's mad because he thought she did know. And she's like, "Uh-oh, I didn't know." And so now here we are. So then don't tweet.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Regret Island.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: More contestants for "Regret Island."

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: So -- and now a word from the boyfriend, whose name is Mod Sun, a rapper. Right? And he says...

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What was that, Juan?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Mod Sun, is that -- am I wrong?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I have no idea.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I figured you knew the music.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You figured Jesse is into rap.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: He probably is, yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Not your stuff, Gutfeld.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: So he says Rob Lowe is guilty of bullying Bella Thorne.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, so he's dragging Rob Lowe through the mud. So here's what I think about it.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: No pun intended.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: As long as you're making confessions...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: After having Bella Thorne moments, I'll -- probably shouldn't, but I'm going to make my own confession.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Which one?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: "Watters' World..."

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: We're back on "Regret Island."

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: The weekend show was supposed to debut about a year and a half ago. And we had taped the show, and we had it all ready to go. And then ISIS attacked Paris. And they had to bump my show. And I'm thinking, "God, you know, they bumped my premier." And then I'm realizing, wait, a lot of people died in Paris. And that was really selfish. But the difference was I didn't tweet about it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Good.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And that's what you have to do. It's also funny that Rob Lowe is now the voice of reason in Hollywood.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And I can't believe I'm saying this, but I actually agree with President Obama. President Obama was on the Letterman thing the other day, and he said this: "My presidency will be like a speck in history. It's just a speck. It's a small little moment in time." And that's what people don't understand. They're so self-consumed in their own little world that they don't see the big picture in the world around them.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Well, Regret Island is quite populous.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: One way to deal with this is to set yourself up, sign up for a local news alert on your phone. And then you'll know what is going on.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Solution.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: She's got the solution.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I also think, at least she didn't actually target, like, the highway workers or a specific company. Because this is one of the worst trends on Twitter.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: When popular or influential people that have a lot of followers use Twitter as a way to shame a company and to try to get special favors for something that maybe happened to them that happens to every other person.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And even it looks like they're trying to do it to try to help the overall thing, I think it makes people look very small. So I would say...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Those are the worst tweets on the planet.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Don't you do that?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, it drives me crazy!

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, you do. When you're flying, I thought you did it all the time.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No. I attack people. I don't attack companies.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You do have this instinct, because you're in the moment and you're mad. You're like, you know what, airline? I'm about to do -- I'm about to light up your world. I would say check yourself before you tweet yourself.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Nice!

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Do you know what the cops once told me about traffic accidents? Most of them are caused by people who think, "This traffic is going too slowly, and I need to get where I'm going." And then they just act irresponsible.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: They're not dirty. David Brooks just wrote about that.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: The pope even just said about this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Pope!

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Anyway, don't move. "Fastest Seven," delightful, up next.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Welcome back. Time for...

utterances.speaker: GRAPHIC
utterances.utterance: Fastest 7

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Oh, boy.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: "The Fastest 7 Minutes in Television." Three stories, seven minutes, let's go. First up, one of the biggest scandals in sports history brought to life again in the new film "I, Tonya." Nancy Kerrigan clubbed in the knee in 1994 right before the Olympics in a plot drummed up by the ex-husband of her competitor, Tanya Harding. Harding now making the rounds to promote the film. The disgraced figure skater wants the world to believe she's the real victim.

utterances.speaker: PIERS MORGAN, BRITISH JOURNALIST
utterances.utterance: Maybe it suits you to play the victim, but I think the victim in all this wasn't you. It was Nancy Kerrigan, who had her Olympic dream shattered, quite literally in her legs.

utterances.speaker: TANYA HARDING, FORMER OLYMPIAN
utterances.utterance: I think that we all -- thank you so much. I appreciate being on your show. But I think I'm going to have to say have a good night.

utterances.speaker: MORGAN
utterances.utterance: You're going to end the interview because I think that Nancy Kerrigan was the victim here, not you?

utterances.speaker: HARDING
utterances.utterance: You weren't letting me finish. I think many that people are the victim of abuse every single day.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Wow! A reporter caught up with Kerrigan, and she says, quote, "I was the victim. That's my role in this whole thing. That's it." I mean, really?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I feel sorry for Nancy Kerrigan, especially after the Golden Globes when I really thought they had -- they had what's-her-face there at the awards.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Tanya.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So you have celebrities lecturing us on, you know, never blaming victims, and they have, probably, an alleged perpetrator who attacked a woman. Or allowed that to happen.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You know what stunned me, was apparently, she wanted to charge journalists 25,000 bucks if you asked about Nancy Kerrigan.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That's ridiculous!

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Wow!

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's a lot of money.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Nancy Kerrigan is the victim. And this woman should have had better media training before she went out and did her press tour.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Kimberly.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: If you're going to "good-night" somebody, then you better "good-night" them. Bam.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's the Kimberly...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes. Time is up.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Next up. David Letterman is back with a new series on Netflix. You might have noticed, he doesn't use a razor anymore. First guest, Barack Obama.

utterances.speaker: BARACK OBAMA, FORMER PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES
utterances.utterance: One of the biggest challenges to our democracy is the degree to which we don't share a common baseline of facts. What the Russians exploited, but it was already here, is we are operating in completely different information universes. It you watch FOX News, you are living on a different planet then you are if you listen to NPR.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: OK. Cheap shot. Do you miss him?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: This is why I would say, Jesse, if you're going to helm "Fastest Seven..."

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: ... you cannot choose a Barack Obama quote for the thing, because it takes up all the time.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Drive a truck through that pause. How about you?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Who's homeless Santa?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You mean Letterman?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: This whole, like, "I am retired and I'm growing a big white beard thing," it started -- like the whole, like, Michael Stipe from REM, same thing. It's the thing -- it's this thing, like, "I no longer have to look good." But it's actually very conspicuous. It's basically saying, "I am so successful, I can look like homeless Santa."

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: You relate to that?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I'd do that, but I can't grow a beard.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Greg can relate to that, yes. I find it terrifying. I don't know what Letterman is doing and what's going on in there. And I don't know. But you know, it was an interesting interview enough, I guess.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It was? Letterman looked bored out of his mind.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I don't know if it's worthy of "Fastest 7." Lowest 10, maybe.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Greg's hit on the producers.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I mean, I didn't get that there was much meat to it. Except I read that he said he explained his dance moves to Letterman and his mom dance moves. So I guess that's like his mom jeans.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Those very high-waisted mom jeans that were sort of, like, acid-washed.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: There you go.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: By the way, the one takeaway -- I'm sorry. Was when the audience applauded because he finished the sentence, because they heard "Fox News." He was saying "Fox News" and "NPR," but they applauded before they got to NPR, because they were trained to think that way.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's right. Like lemmings. Finally, this video has been viewed more than 50 million times. We showed it to you earlier this week. A man trying to get in the car to go to work is taken down by the driveway beneath him. It was covered by a sheet of ice. He's OK and laughing about it along with the rest of us today.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Your wife, when you came inside after falling, the first thing she said was, "Let's look at that video," right?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Correct.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: On the security cam?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Correct. Not how am I? Just check the video. It's just funny. I laugh every time when I watch it. I got a round of applause yesterday when I went to work. It's just surreal. I don't know how to describe this. People are reaching out to my wife and myself saying it made their day. That's -- that's been the best part of it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Fifty million views, Greg. He doesn't get paid for any of that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I studied the wrong video, when I saw the -- I thought it was the car during the storm going down in the mud.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: We had this on the show already. You know that, right?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I know, but that's why I didn't think we were doing this. I thought it was a car in the mudslide.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Next time we will have you prepared.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: OK. What about you?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I just am so glad that he fell before he ran into the road where he could have been hit by a car.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Aw, Dana, you're so sweet.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I'm just worried about a head injury.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You know what strikes me, is the security video. Every embarrassing moment in your life now is chronicled for all time. I mean...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: When you're on "The Five."

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But your wife -- his wife, my gosh, boy, she really loves him, huh?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Kimberly, you've never fallen like that?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No. Never slipped up once?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: No videos of me like that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No videos.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: There's some good videos but not of that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: None of that? OK. "Facebook Friday" when "The Five" returns.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Very healthy drink, Coca-Cola. "Facebook Friday." We have your questions. I have it for breakfast. You should try it, too.

utterances.speaker: This is a great question from Edana F.
utterances.utterance: "What's the first thing you do when you get home from work?" Kimberly?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Don't look at me. What? I was looking down.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I know, I could tell.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: You don't take social cues very well.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'm the opposite of social cue expert.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I really -- it depends. It depends!

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Usually you try to wake me up.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: What a freak. Let me tell you something...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: She calls me and she says, "Are you home?"

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: You're on Regret Island, not Fantasy Island, buddy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Nicely done.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Indeed. It depends on who I'm with. Let's say that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Ohhh! Juan, first thing you do?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, I think the question might be headed in a different direction. But I'll tell you, literally the first thing I do is I wash off all this makeup.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's true. My wife goes nuts. Because if I forget that and it's all over the pillow cases.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes, it's everywhere.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's like the Shroud of Turin.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I just take off all my clothes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No!

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No, I mean no. I just take off my shoes, Gutfeld. All right. I take off my shoes. And then I DVR "The Five," and I watch it.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: You watch yourself naked?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You get dressed before you watch yourself?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He watches himself...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Naked. That's what he does!

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes, you do. You just said it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Gutfeld, get your mind out of the gutter.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: You find yourself disgusting?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, jeez.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Downhill.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I say hello to Peter and Jasper and then I do take my makeup off.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's good.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Put my hair in a pony tail.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Do you really?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: God, I so don't do that. I mean, I just don't.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: The first thing I do is...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I stay like this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I unhook Steven from the basement chain.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That's nice of you. It's a long day.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Steven?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: What happened to Dobbs?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Dobbs doesn't talk to me anymore. Joanne D. This is a great question. An excellent question. Think about this one. Joanne D. asks, "Would you rather travel back in time to meet your ancestors or to the future to meet your descendants and why?"

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, that's easy for me.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Why? What?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, I don't have any descendants, so I'm going to have to go back in time. But I would love, love, love, love, love to go back in time and see my family.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes? What if they're jerks?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That's OK.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes? They probably are. You know, people in way back then, they were definitely jerky.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I would like to go and talk to them about their decision to -- to immigrate to America.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right. Good question. Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, the Watters family comes from a very long line of prestigious and noble men.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Naked people.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: From Norway.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Supercilious Norwegians.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes. I'd go back, obviously.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You'd go back, too.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I'd go back. I'd go back.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I think just going back, Juan, I'd be disappointed. Everybody'd be disappointed, because you know, they don't -- they're not up on the latest trends, hygiene-wise. The 1700s was a smelly period.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes, kind of like what President Trump might call a...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He turned middle ages.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: All those people who are coming over here. Not acceptable.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Here we go.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I would go forward.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Because you know what? I love history. So I always am curious. And, you know, being a black American, I -- there's huge holes going back, so I would fill in a lot of holes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: S-holes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes, not that one.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Eww!

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, I mean, it was a play -- play on words.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You walked right into that one, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But going forward, I think it would be -- I mean, one of the questions I have in my mind as I get older is, you know, will I see my grandchildren, like, graduate and get married, stuff like that? I'd love...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes, you will.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: He wants to see all the pictures so he can post them.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, no. You know, I'm going to send them to Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: "One More Thing." Kimberly, would you rather go in the Flintstones' direction or the Jetsons' direction? Backwards or forwards?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I would probably want to go backwards, believe it or not. I think so. I would be a little bit torn about it, you know, because it was good to go back, depending on how far you could go back. But then I would also probably like to, you know, see the descendants of my son.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: This question is irrelevant to me, because I will be living forever. My brain in a vat of nutrients. That's how it's going to be. I'll be there.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Perfect world: no body, just my brain in a vat.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Perfect.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Smiling.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No mouth?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No mouth.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Excellent.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No smiling. I'll be thinking about smiling. You know what makes me smile? "One More Thing."

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Ah, perfect.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Transition.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Transition.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: What is wrong with you?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Nothing.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: It's time now for "One More Thing." Kimberly, you go first. Thanks.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Sure.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: All right. This is a very cute story. Dana, you're going to love it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I'm paying attention.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: It's very nice. Happy ending for a sweet dog. And this is a dog that's a Pyrenees in Seminole, Oklahoma. Kathleen is a six-year-old. Look at her, so cute -- Great Pyrenees mix. When her owners moved and could not keep her, they gave her to someone who lived 20 miles away. She missed her old family, so not once but twice she walked 20 miles back home in search of them, to try to find them, to be reunited.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Aww.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: The Seminole Humane Society took control and worked to find her a new home. We have very good news. There was tons of applications all across the country. And today, she has been adopted and will be moving to Texas to be with her new forever family.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Isn't is that so sweet?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Aww.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: She ate a little cheeseburger.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Cute.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Ate a little cheeseburger. Can you imagine? I kind of feel sad she can't be with that family. But nevertheless, thank you, Texas family. Great state of Texas.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Peter had a dog in his life that did that once. So cute.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right. Enough about dogs, OK? Saturday, "Greg Gutfeld Show," 10 p.m. I've got Pete Hegseth. You know him. Comedian Alli Breen. She's hilarious. Kat Timpf, you know her. And of course, Tyrus. Now it's time for something very important.

utterances.speaker: GRAPHIC
utterances.utterance: Greg's Doppelganger News

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: "Greg's Doppelganger News." That's a foreign word for double. Anyway. Take a look at Fluffy McPawpaw over here, has happily met her double.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And they got along quite well, until she realized that her double is dead and stuffed.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Aww.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's a terrible prank to play on Fluffy McPawpaw. Now she'll be in therapy for the remaining nine lives.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: OK. So no dog stories, but like, weird cat stories with a fake cat?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Exactly. You figured me out.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes, I'm onto you. Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, talking about hating on TV. Look at this. One woman's trip to the bowling alley...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Say what?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: ... with her family in Brazil was a smash hit on local TV. And I mean really a hit. Watch as this woman practices her bowling technique.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Oh, my God!

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Did she have to pay for that?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Instead of gliding down the lanes, the ball goes up so high it crashes into a television monitor hanging from the ceiling. I don't know if she had to pay for the TV, but obviously, this was a strike on the media. Terrible.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Let me give her some lessons.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Who's got to pay for that?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I don't know.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Come on.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: They've got to have insurance.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: It's crazy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It is.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, I stole this from idea Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, good.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And I admit it. But when I heard that his alma mater, Berkeley, was bringing in therapy llamas for the snowflakes who were stressed out about exams, I decided to bring my own therapy llama to the set of "Watters' World." Here's a taste.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What's it got? It's got something.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: It's got a piece of hay in its mouth.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's got...

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Take it out. Go ahead.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You want me to take the...

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: See if you can take it out. I think you can do it. I think you can do it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh, oh! I touched its lip.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: OK. So the therapy llama and I had a nice time together. And you're going to see the whole thing, 8 p.m. Eastern Saturday night.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You're really upping the ante on the Saturday night show. What are you going to do next week?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'm going to have two llamas.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: By the way, here's what I heard around the building.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What's that?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: The llama stinks.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's true.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: OK, I will go. So the Tour Down Under cycling race has begun in Australia. As one reporter prepared for her hit, watch this, a different story unfolded. So she's there just talking about it, talking about it. And this truck comes by and takes the whole thing down.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Wow.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right there on live TV and didn't even stop. And these people spent all this time to put it up. But they got it up in time again for the first cyclists to pass through. And the race is just getting started and continues through through next week. It's hot down there, too.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: That's strange.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Not very good.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Not as strange as the weird llama thing. I don't even know.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Hard to care about bicyclists.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I have a lot of stress in my life.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: All right. By the way, you stressed out the llama. It needs a therapy llama.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: True.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Set your -- yes. Set your DVRs. Never miss an episode of "The Five." Everybody have a great weekend. "Special Report" is next.
